page.title: 04Special Events in Cheddleton
page.content: The various clubs and activities in Cheddleton are the main inspiration behind the many special events. Recently a 'Cheddleton Remembers' evening at St. Edwards Church when old photographs and films were displayed. A flower festival held in 1984 raised Â£1000 for St. Edwards Church funds. A carnival is held yearly to raise money for local charities with Carnival Queen, float competitions and side shows. A concert was given bi-annually by the Corn Dollies in St. Edwards hospital a proportion of the proceeds being donated to the hospital in return for the use of their facilities At Christmas a special Santa Claus train runs at he Cheddleton Railway Museum. In the summer the Salvation Army hold an open air service at the canalside.
